utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, CO-HOST
utterances.utterance: Hello, everybody. I'm Jesse Watters along with Kennedy, Juan Williams, Abby Huntsman, and Greg Gutfeld. It's 5 o'clock in New York City, and this is "The Five." President Trump taking off the gloves to deliver a major blow against potential 2020 rival Joe Biden.

utterances.speaker: PRESIDENT DONALD TRUMP
utterances.utterance: I dream about Biden, that's a dream. Look, Joe Biden ran three times. He never got more than 1 percent, and President Obama took him out of the garbage heap and everybody was shocked that he did. I'd love to have it be Biden. I think I'd like to have any one of those people that we're talking about. You know, there's probably -- the group of seven or eight right now, I'd really like to run against any one of them. But Biden, never by himself, could never do anything. President Obama took him, made him vice president and he was fine.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Crazy Uncle Joe is saying he's going to make a decision about taking on Trump by January. If he does, here's a preview of potential coming attractions.

utterances.speaker: FORMER VICE PRESIDENT JOE BIDEN
utterances.utterance: They asked me would I like to debate this gentleman. I said no. I said if we were in high school, I'd take him behind the gym and beat the hell out of him.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: I've got Biden he said I'm going to take him behind the gym. Oh, I've dream of that, Biden.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.utterance: I would like to take him behind the gym if I were in high school. I mean, all kidding aside, wouldn't you? I mean, for real.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: Can you imagine if I ever made that statement? Donald Trump is a bully. He threatened Vice President Biden. But he can say that, everyone thought, oh, that was a wonderful statement.

utterances.speaker: BIDEN
utterances.utterance: Look, folks.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: You know what you do with Biden? You go like this. And he'd fall over. Tough guy. Mr. Tough Guy. Mr. Tough Guy.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: So, before get to that news, there's some other news I want to address. I have a new hairstyle.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I want to take it around the table. If anybody could notice this side, this side, it's a little different. What do you think, Greg?

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, CO-HOST
utterances.utterance: I would just say if you think Biden is running you're as high as Jesse's hair because you're a cross between Morrissey and Elvis in the bad years.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I'm going to take that as a compliment.

utterances.speaker: ABBY HUNTSMAN, GUEST CO-HOST
utterances.utterance: I think it looks like he just got out of a nice convertible. Right outside the office, came in to work.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Thank you very much.

utterances.speaker: HUNTSMAN
utterances.utterance: Very, very refreshing.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Much nicer than Greg. What about you, Juan? Juan, you're looking at me like you've never seen a hair.

utterances.speaker: JUAN WILLIAMS, CO-HOST
utterances.utterance: I didn't notice. I feel bad because, you know.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I should pay more attention to my friends. I mean, I don't know. It looks.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's to the side and parted more wavy back.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: What are you trying to accomplish?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: My hairstyle is took on thoughts, so this is out of necessity. I just haven't gotten it cut, so I just tried to rework it. What do you think, Kennedy?

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY, CO-HOST
utterances.utterance: I thought the best reaction was from Michelle backstage who is one of the hair people here at Fox. And you asked her if she liked your new hair and she went, huh.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: She doesn't want anything to do with this.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: I think it looks like you went downhill skiing without a helmet, and that's a compliment.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right, let's get to the news. Greg, what did you think about this potential matchup, Biden versus Trump?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well, it just tells you how hard it is to be a Democrat. Is this a party or a rest home? And Biden is a walking gaffe machine. But it's not just his mouth, it's his hands. This guy -- he shouldn't be running for president. He should be the head of the TSA. He's so touchy-feely. He doesn't just feel your pain, he feels everything. He missed his calling as a chiropractor. But I think -- I don't think -- you know what's funny?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: What?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know who gave us Trump? I think President Obama gave us Trump by talking Biden out of running. If he haven't talked Biden -- wasn't Biden thinking about it? And then.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Well, he didn't want to go against Hillary.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It was her turn.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It was her turn, exactly, exactly.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Do you think that Biden could get through a primary against Bernie Sanders? I mean, that's going to be tooth to nail knockout brawl, I think.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, talk about geriatric, yeah. You know, so the whole idea is Biden would be like 78.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Seventy eight. Then you think, wait a minute, Trump is like 74.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: But he's high-energy.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh, please. So, I mean -- I mean, you say, oh, the Democrats, you know, what kind of party is this, what do they have? But look at what the Republicans have done with a 70-year-old man, right? So, I mean, I don't see any big difference. But can he get past Bernie? I think one of the big negatives for Vice President Biden, Senator Biden, however you want to say it, there's a lot of baggage there having to do with things like his stance on abortion in the Democratic Party. But also, remember, he was a big advocate in terms of questioning for Clarence Thomas in those hearings. And I think a lot of women might have questions about it. I don't think it's a matter of touchy-feely. You can control that. And, boy, does President Trump ever have some issues with touchy-feely.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But not on camera.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh, no, that's was the NBC.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Kennedy, what do you think?

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: Couple of things here. I think Greg is absolutely right because not only did President Obama give us President Trump because it was just a counter reaction to a two-term presidency and that happens every time, and they're both pretty extreme when you take them apart. But also, President Obama goaded Trump into running at the White House Correspondents Association Dinner. He singled him out from the dais. It was a very funny performance, but he really challenged him, and that's essentially when he got into the race. Biden, this is interesting for Democrats because it says a lot about the party. It says, you know, there's a big split right now between moderates and progressives. He's polling at the top of the field right now. Sanders, actually, comes in third just next to Hillary. So, Biden is around 30 percent, Hillary is 18, Sanders is 16, and Warren is at 10 percent. But it says that they are going in a more moderate direction that they don't just want a bully and they don't just want a progressive, and they certainly don't want a progressive boy like Elizabeth Warren.

utterances.speaker: HUNTSMAN
utterances.utterance: I think it also shows how short the Democrat's bench is as we're talking about the age of Joe Biden. And the next person in line is Bernie Sanders? I mean, that is where we are right now. Here's what I would say. No one has won trying to out bully Trump.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: HUNTSMAN
utterances.utterance: . right? So it's clear that Joe Biden is wanting to get dirty in the mud with him, and I'm not sure he wants to go there. If he does decide to run, you can expect things to get really, really ugly. I don't know that's going to be good for this country. I think bigger picture is what is the Democratic Party going to stand for. Is Biden going to be the more moderate voice or is he going to appeal to the Elizabeth Warren crowd, because, ultimately, you've got to win the primary first. And a lot of them are talking about abolishing ICE. They want, you know, less border security. So what is the messaging going to be? I think that's going to be the question.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I think the answer is pretty clear now because, you know, the success of Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, and much of the party buys into this is the idea that you have good health care in this country, so bring back affordable care, Obamacare, however you want to describe it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But you say good health care.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, providing it for those who need. Secondly, you have to do something about the high cost of college tuition, so, therefore, more in that thing. And I think, finally, you talk about incomes, and earlier this week on this show, we talked about whether or not guaranteed incomes are socialist, whatever. But more and more Americans think, yeah, you know what, there're too many people.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: All three of those aspects where government does not need a bureaucratic stranglehold on health care, or education, or jobs, or anything else. I mean, that's the problem. When government gets in the way of all that, you stifle growth. But, back to Joe Biden, he's a politician. I think he will be able to triangulate. He's also really well-liked. That's one of the problems that the rest of the field other than Bernie Sanders, they have a hard time with that critical likability. And, obviously, you know, other than Facebook and Latvian bot farms, and Russia, that's a.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And he's a lifelong politician. And I don't know if this country wants more of the establishment, more of the swamp, more of these professional politicians.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Can I raise the thing I've said that you mocked me for. I can't remember. It was two days ago.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Is it still stinging?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, it is. Hillary, if Hillary doesn't have a rematch, and I believe the specter of a rematch will outweigh the dislike for her within the party. I think that the idea of a rematch could be so big historically -- probably the most historical presidential elections in history would be a rematch between Trump and Hillary, that everybody would want it because she can't -- it will be the first line in her obituary that she lost to Trump. She has to do that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: There would be a draft Hillary movement, you think that would happen?

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: I don't think she'll be the nominee. I don't think she won't survive the primaries.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I mean, she barely got through Bernie and it's only because she rigged it. All right. Now let's look at the midterm election which is only about two months away, a little bit over that. House Democrats unveiling their new campaign slogan, you ready? It's called for the people. They're also reaching out to supporters with power players like Michelle Obama. The former first lady is launching a voter registration initiative featuring anti-Trump celebs. She's also making comments that may remind you of this.

utterances.speaker: FORMER FIRST LADY MICHELLE OBAMA
utterances.utterance: And let me tell you something. For the first time in my adult life, I am proud of my country because it feels like hope is finally making a comeback.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: In a speech in Scotland this week, Mrs. Obama reportedly said, quote, the last election in my country does not give me hope. All right, Greg, do you want to take on Michelle Obama or the new Dems slogan?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: The slogan is pure communism. Any time you see people in it, it's communist like the People's Republic of China. That doesn't sound too Democratic to me. I think.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: How about we the people?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I'm against that as well.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Which people are the Democrats are talking about?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: We the people.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Is it illegal aliens or the people.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You know that's what the problem with the earlier part of this conversation thing. Oh, Joe Biden is a bully. He's threatening to beat up -- what do -- oh, Trump said something about grabbing women in a certain part, you know. Oh, I remember that now. Maybe if we offered some context the audience would say, oh, good for Joe Biden.

utterances.speaker: HUNTSMAN
utterances.utterance: No one is saying that Trump isn't a bully.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Juan is saying all the things he wasn't able to say earlier.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, I'm just saying, when you like contacts when you say, oh, what about Biden? What about Biden? What about Trump?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: OK, let's move on.

utterances.speaker: HUNTSMAN
utterances.utterance: But also the celebrity part of this, I think we learned from 2016 that celebrities don't win elections. I mean, how many times we saw Katy Perry, Miley Cyrus on that stage with Hillary Clinton.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: They actually lose election. Remember that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Trump is a celebrity and he won.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: . that had all those crazy celebs saying I want to kill President Trump.

utterances.speaker: HUNTSMAN
utterances.utterance: Actually, I think, energizes the base to get out for Republicans a lot of times because they feel like they don't connect with the elites, they don't connect with celebrities. Michelle Obama is also quite popular right now though in the Democratic Party. So, that is a better move for them than using Hillary Clinton and Bill Clinton on his book tour.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: She should run.

utterances.speaker: HUNTSMAN
utterances.utterance: . I mean, that is a disaster. So.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Michelle Obama ran.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: She might win.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yeah. It would be.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: You're actually right, the contrast between the speech that she gave at the DNC in 2016, her farewell speech, that was one of the best speeches of both conventions. And now, you know, people for the first time in their adult lives set up and said, wow, I really like Michelle Obama. She's making such sense and her message truly resonates. And, you know, she's a lawyer. She essentially has the same background that Hillary Clinton had before she carpet bagged her way to the U.S. senate.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: To Abby's point, it shows you how shallow the Democratic bench is that people are looking for a hail Mary person like Michelle Obama. There's no way she's running.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: What happened to the GOP bench in '16? Donald Trump.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You meant '17.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yeah. He stepped on all of them. He crushed them all.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But that's the contrast principle. When there are 17 similar and one different, the one different always rises above. It's going to happen with the Democrats. You're going to get 17 politicians and you might get a Michelle, or you might get an Oprah, or you might get a Mark Ruffalo.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I say Mark Ruffalo.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Ruffalo-Cortez.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I was surprise to see that Tim McGraw, Faith Hill, are part of Michelle Obama's team. I thought country music people wouldn't.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: No, no, no, they've always been pretty liberal.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, I'm glad to hear it. I think country music stars are very slow.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You guys can have them. We'll have the rest of the country scene. All right, the brink of a war with Russia. President Trump is blasting the media by saying that's exactly what they want to see, up next.

utterances.speaker: HUNTSMAN
utterances.utterance: All right, President Trump firing back at the media amid a new round of criticism over his summit with Vladimir Putin. This, as we are now learning from the White House that the president has asked National Security Advisor John Bolton to invite Putin to Washington in the fall. Meantime, Trump is lashing out on twitter saying the fake news is pushing for a major confrontation with Russia, even one that could lead to war. Contrary to the press outrage, President Trump defends his performance in Helsinki. Here he is.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: I don't know what the fuss is all about. I think we did extremely well. And I think the press makes up the fight. Look, it's fake news and people understand. I think the press largely makes up a lot of the fuss about a lot of things. And I'm not talking about one event. I'm talking about everything. It's crazy. You do something that's positive and they try to make it as negative as possible.

utterances.speaker: HUNTSMAN
utterances.utterance: The print media also piling on. Time Magazine latest cover -- look at this, features Trump and Putin morphing into the same person. And there's The New Yorker depicting the president falling down the Trump Tower escalator and landing flat on his face but still managing to give a thumbs up. So, it has been quite a week since Monday. Kennedy, I'm going to go to you for this. Look, I'm the first to say that many in the media never give the president the benefit of the doubt, but this is no rough week. And this one was very much teed up for the president. All you have to do was say I stand by my intelligence community, we're going to do everything we can to make sure this doesn't happen in future elections. Why has this narrative been so tough for the White House?

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: And he could have warned Vladimir Putin of that in their private meeting. He could have said, listen, this is something that I have to do politically. You understand politics. I have to go out there, I have to condemn this whole thing. It can't happen again. Blah, blah, blah. It would have been pretty easy. It's kind of a layup. He knows that. And I think that's why he's talking about having this summit. And I said it yesterday and I'll say it again, and I hope someone in the White House is listening, it is so -- everyone is transfixed when the president has open meetings that are televised and catches everyone off guard by going around the room and he should do the same thing with Vladimir Putin. They should absolutely have a televised conversation, not a press conference where people are asking him questions, where they are going back-and-forth with their translators and so he can knock him off his game a little bit. If he does the same thing again with Putin and repeats the same mistakes, it's going to be very problematic. It's such a quick news cycle. People have such a short attention span. We can absolutely move on.

utterances.speaker: HUNTSMAN
utterances.utterance: Jesse, do you think the president understands the severity and the seriousness of what we are faced with when it comes to Russia hacking and the meddling?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I think he's heard it, but I don't think he thinks it's as serious as some other issues.

utterances.speaker: HUNTSMAN
utterances.utterance: Or do you think he feel like it delegitimizes his win?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Oh, absolutely would think that. I absolutely think that. It's very important for him to spike that football because that was a great win. Let's remember, Pennsylvania, Wisconsin, Michigan, I mean, historic. But the real thing is the left is trying to create this new world war with Russia. They're not tough people, Abby. I mean, these people won't even say radical Islam. They get upset when you pour water on a terrorist's face. They think global warming is a bigger threat than terrorism. They ran away and surrendered during the cold war. And now all of a sudden, you know, they're tough guys. They want to take on Putin. Stop. You guys aren't tough. You guys ran tail every time America was faced with any real threat. And so many other things affected Hillary's loss, the deplorable comment, the fainting. I mean, everything that she did, Comey, the email server. Just because they published a few emails of people at the Clinton Foundation badmouthing Chelsea for using the foundation as a piggy bank for the wedding, that didn't swing votes. She never even went to Wisconsin, Juan. This whole thing was cooked up as an excuse. And then you never would have heard about all these hacking and all these stuff if Hillary had won. It would have been a little blimp.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Let me just ask you, do you ever crack a history book? Did you ever hear about FDR.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I majored in history.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: FDR taking on.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I'm talking about the modern day.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Kennedy going after Khrushchev and staring him down?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: How about Obama taking out Bin Laden? He must have been a Republican.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: How about the Democratic Party being against missile defense.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You know what this is, though? It's unbelievable to me that he would invite Putin here in the fall. Maybe Putin will be here to see how he interferes in the midterms. Dan Coats, Trump's director of national intelligence, said it's an ongoing effort by the Russians to interfere.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I think he knows he's so clean on collusion, he doesn't care about having a second summit.

utterances.speaker: HUNTSMAN
utterances.utterance: Juan, do you think that Russia and the U.S. should have a relationship? Do you think there're more important issues than that that they can work together on?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: There's nothing bigger than our democracy, so you've got to protect the United States. You've got to say we as a.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Oh, why don't you protect the border, Juan?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I will protect the border.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You're all into protecting electoral integrity but not the integrity of the border.

utterances.speaker: HUNTSMAN
utterances.utterance: All right, Greg.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I'd like integrity of the border. But I've got to say when you don't say clearly in the meeting that took place, hey, Mr. Putin, you're not calling back the U.S. ambassador and try to prosecute and interrogate him, and then has to come out today and say, oh, I'm sorry, of course we're not going to do that. That's craziness.

utterances.speaker: HUNTSMAN
utterances.utterance: Well, and then, Greg, to say that you would at least think about trading our people for the 12 that were indicted in Russia, it's been a rough week.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I go back to yesterday's point, you're asking like does he know that this is a problem? No, because he assumed everybody knew what he was doing because in the campaign he said it wouldn't be such a bad thing to develop a relationship with Russia. Why? Because if you offer a little bit of deference, as a salesman, as a real estate tycoon, you know a little bit of deference with a bad guy could get you cooperation on A, B, C, and D. A, North Korea, B, Iran, C, Middle East -- possibly Iran. Now, this is what going to be interesting to me, what happens if we get what we want? What happens if we get something out of this deal six months from now a year from now? Will CNN and MSNBC suddenly confessed that he was not in Putin's pocket, that he was in America's pocket the entire time? This is a guy that the media accuses of being a nationalist and a traitor at the same time. A warmonger and a collusioner which is impossible. Trump moving forward on the second meeting is brilliant because he's not hiding his motives. He's saying, you know what, I don't care if you think I'm in his pockets. I'm going ahead with this because I believe I can get prosperity and peace by dealing with a thug way better than you did for the past 20 years under this -- oh, he's evil. In the video game of life, saying Putin is evil is just level one. You've got to move up to the next level. You've got to deal with him. That's what he's doing. And he did the negotiation in the perfect order. He built up the military. He upgraded the stick. Now he's got the carrot. The left always does it reverse. They throw the carrots at everybody.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: I just want to push on that a little bit.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You can't, Kennedy. It's my moment. You're not going to be Whoopi -- my Judge Jeanine.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: I hate it when people call me hysterical. That's what makes me hysterical.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: With North Korea you know there's something tangible that we can get out of it. You could denuclearize.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: But he hasn't got a thing.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: That is a process and I am willing to give him patients there. But with Russia.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But we're against good news.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: What are we getting from Russia? We have a bigger economy, we are more powerful. We do not have to be deferential to that degree.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's part of his toolkit.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You know the biggest part of the toolkit is?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: What?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I saw a poll that a 79 percent of Republicans say Trump did fine with Putin. It makes me just like bizarre. I don't understand.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: We're not going to have room for your package.

utterances.speaker: HUNTSMAN
utterances.utterance: The media will be right in front of midterms, so that will be fascinating timing. Moving on though, liberal firestorm sends one Hollywood actor running for the hills after praising conservative Ben Shapiro. Oh, no, that is next.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: Such a dance party. Actor Mark Duplass is facing major backlash from his fellow lefties for tweeting something truly horrifying and downright despicable. Are you ready? Get your barf bag. He tweeted praise for conservative Ben Shapiro. How dare he? He wrote, quote, fellow liberals, if you are interested at all in crossing the aisle, wink, you should consider following at Ben Shapiro. I don't agree with him on much but he's a genuine person who once helped me for no other reason than to be nice. He doesn't bend the truth. His intentions are good. Ultimately, the left wing frenzy was too much for Duplass. He not only deleted the tweet, but actually apologized for the egregious act of reaching across the political aisle. My garden, Jesse Watters, what is it come to? He's not endorsing Ben Shapiro's weight loss plan. He's just saying I disagree with him, but the guy is sincere.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And that's a great plan. Gutfeld and I are both on that plan and we look really trim.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: Very trim, true.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I think the Democratic Party just has tighter discipline than the Republican Party. Ideologically they run a really tight ship. They have a lot of discipline. And the minute there's a hint that someone might even be curious about crossing the line of bipartisanship, smacks them, gets them right back to the reservation. Look what happens when black Americans all of a sudden may be moved to the right. They're savagely attacked. Or when women in the Trump administration, savagely attacked for being traitors to their gender. And, you know, this is how they operate, because I believe Democrats feel like politics is religion and you have to adhere to their very strict dogma. And if you disagree with them or then kind of do anything against that dogma, they will outcast you and brand you as a traitor.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Do you catch the news, that it's like 90 percent of Republicans support Trump?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, I did catch that news.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Talk about orthodoxy and the refusal to move in the face of facts (ph).

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: But I do think sometimes Republicans can be more bipartisan than Democrats.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I'd be interested to see it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: John McCain, for example.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: So let's take an issue like abortion. Or how about gun rights?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Are there any pro-life Democrats --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Or how about -- yes there are.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: -- in Congress right now.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I don't know. I don't think so. Is there one? OK, I don't know. But how about gun rights? Do we see Republicans moving on that?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: What about Rudy Giuliani? He's not necessarily a strict --

utterances.speaker: HUNTSMAN
utterances.utterance: This highlights -- this highlights the problem, though, the lack of civility that we have in this country.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: The world has turned into Jesse and Juan.

utterances.speaker: HUNTSMAN
utterances.utterance: Well, no, just that you can't have a reasonable conversation or compliment someone on the other side of the political aisle. By the way, don't mess with Ben Shapiro. Have you seen him go up against Bill Maher?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HUNTSMAN
utterances.utterance: He's the one conservative I've seen really go head-to-head with Bill Maher. But I think this highlights how so many people are feeling in this country. I mean, I can't sit down with members of my own family today and talk politics. My husband and I say before we go out to dinner with them, just make sure you don't bring up anything politically related.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Wow.

utterances.speaker: HUNTSMAN
utterances.utterance: Because someone's going to walk out of the room.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: I don't have a political family, so that's easy.

utterances.speaker: HUNTSMAN
utterances.utterance: It's great. So we just don't have dinner together. But I think this -- this highlights --

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: Weight loss.

utterances.speaker: HUNTSMAN
utterances.utterance: -- where we are right now in this country and -- and the lack of civility and the lack of respect. And the unwillingness for people to cross that aisle and say, you know, "We may disagree on something." And look, you guys do it all the time, and I think you do it pretty well.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: He wasn't endorsing anything. I mean, he was merely expressing curiosity.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But I was going to say, there are places where you can find, like, some really good civility. There's a show on ABC called "The View." Everybody there is really polite. Anyway, OK, so there's a trend going on here against dialogue among the left. If you talk to anybody, that's wrong. So the idea of dialogue with Shapiro, is equivalent or conspiring with evil, and therefore, you can't dialogue with evil. So the only alternative is violence. And as human beings, we evolved -- communication evolved to prevent us beating each other to death with clubs. But now we're in separate clubs. I'm tired of the shallow social media mob action. These people actually really don't care that much, but they enjoy getting a scalp. So it's scalp collecting online. They think that this it some kind of achievement to go after this guy, Duplass. And he deletes the tweet, which was cowardice. But I believe it's time for a group effort on the other side to counter mob actions. And that means defending people who are under attack. If you see somebody that's being attacked, whether it's Duplass, you do a segment like this and you say, "Look, you know, this shit's got -- this stuff's got to stop. Excuse me. Apologize preemptively. Anyway.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's got to stop.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: By the way -- by the way, attacking somebody online does not persuade anyone. What it does is it will push somebody like Duplass into the center away from the left, and you see this with -- with podcasts like Dave Rubin and whatnot. They were once leftists, and now they're being pushed to the center.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: Bari Weiss had a fascinating article about that in The New York Times.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Do you think Trump has anything to do with tribalism and pushing people into --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I think identity politics got there first.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: I think -- I think that showed to identity politics. I think it's happening on both sides.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes, white nationalism and neo-Nazis.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: We need robots.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: It has moved to total extremes. Thank you for that. Teeing it up right. Thousands of tech leaders unite to stop the rise of killer robots. But is it already too late to avoid a robopocalypse?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Whoa.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: Greg explains.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: You must listen, next.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: A bunch of smart people called scientists signed a pledge to block the creation of lethal autonomous weapons -- meaning: killer robots. I guess they finally saw "Terminator."

utterances.speaker: But before we hail this unity against killer machines, consider this
utterances.utterance: It's too late. We already have killer robots. They're called drones. And if you don't get there first and make the best, most -- most lethal ones, someone else will. See nukes.

utterances.speaker: Bottom-line
utterances.utterance: The country who masters new weapons first runs the earth and, of course, the universe. It better be us, not China. Besides, no one wants autonomous weapons acting on their own anyway. It's a myth. Consider the modern drone, a more effective weapon in that it can pick off the bad guy and spare the innocent people. It works because dozens of humans are involved operating that drone. It creates jobs. And if a drone can tell the difference between an ISIS meeting and a wedding, then banning them is wrong and evil. Elon Musk signed this pledge against killer weapons, but he also makes driverless cars, which can be killer weapons when they screw up. But even if a driverless car screws up, it will screw up less than one driven by a mistake-prone, distracted human. 1.3 million people die in car crashes a year. Driverless cars, as scary as they sound, will make fatal car crashes as uncommon as airline disasters.

utterances.speaker: The bottom line
utterances.utterance: You can't prevent technology from leaving the barn until it's already galloped out and then you have to own it. Centuries ago, the pope tried to ban crossbows. How did that work out? All right. I'm going to go -- As always, go to the person who I know agrees with me. Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I love robots, because they don't have the human flaws of distraction and exhaustion, which will help them make better decisions in war, as they do in traffic.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I really like the idea of killer robots in urban warfare, because you can automatically identify who the civilians are --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: -- and who's armed. It computes immediately. I think you save lives on the civilian side and you save the life of a soldier that doesn't have to be put in that position.

utterances.speaker: I do find it funny that the robotics industry is on the precipice of two major breakthroughs
utterances.utterance: creating a sex robot and a killer robot. Like, the scientists are like 12-year-old boys. But I also like the idea of putting robots -- not killer robots -- but robots on the border. Because then you can detain the illegals crossing until Border Patrol gets there, and then the Democrats can't accuse the robots of being racist, because they're robots.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know what, though? Juan, there's a point. Robots have no emotions. They can't be racist. They can't be hungry.

utterances.speaker: HUNTSMAN
utterances.utterance: That's awful. You have robots running around the world, killing people with no heart, no soul, no emotion.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That means they kill less. No, that means they kill less. Don't you get it? Emotion is what drives people to make mistakes. Massacres are caused by emotion, people that go off. Robots will not commit massacres. I don't know that for a fact.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: They lack emotion; they lack empathy. They have --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Empathy is overrated, according to studies.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: They have underdeveloped emotions.

utterances.speaker: HUNTSMAN
utterances.utterance: I don't know about those studies.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: I understand -- I understand the drive to not create more killing machines.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: I think that's better. And technology has always been a double- edged sword. And this is not the first time --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: A sword's technology.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: -- in the evolution of humankind that we have been faced with technological conundrums and issues. And I tend to trust technology more. But I do think we have to ask ourselves as a society, what are leaning toward? Are we creating technology for peace? Are we bringing people together? By and large, yes. There are some issues here and there but hopefully the majority of whatever defense spending there is in --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. KENNEDY; -- our robot overlords, it's not designed to kill.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You're pro-robot.

utterances.speaker: HUNTSMAN
utterances.utterance: I do agree with you, though. I think that if we don't do it, ultimately, you will see Russia and you will see China.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: China's already doing it.

utterances.speaker: HUNTSMAN
utterances.utterance: You know what they're doing in China, by the way? They're setting up a system of facial recognition. Everywhere you go.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes, we talked --

utterances.speaker: HUNTSMAN
utterances.utterance: I'm sure you guys have. Everywhere you go, --

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: That's why they're stealing American technology.

utterances.speaker: HUNTSMAN
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: They want to make those exponential leaps.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Do any of you read science fiction?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Do you go to the movies? Have you seen "Robocop"? Did you see what happens?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: It wasn't good. Robocop goes wild.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He's half-human, though. He was emotional, Juan. He was emotional. That's what -- Robocop still had in his mind the memories of being shot, and that's what was driving him crazy.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Here's the reason that you see so many technology people say, "Hey, we've got to stop." Because it's not that they worry about even China or the United States. It's that they worry about people --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: -- third-world people who somehow get this technology, they're bad guys. And suddenly, they start --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No, no, no. When you capture the killer robot, it automatically explodes, so they can't steal the secrets.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Very good.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: Everyone knows that you squirt them with water.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Or unplug them. You unplug them. That's simple. By the way, to your point, you've got to play offense to play defense. So you know they're going to get them anyway, so you get the better ones, and you win.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: Do you watch "Westworld"?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Overrated. First -- no, the movie from 1972, fantastic.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: TV show.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But the first -- I'm going, but she asked about "Westworld," and I have an opinion on "Westworld"! The first season, excellent. Second season, convoluted, confusing.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: All right, Whoopee.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Juan -- I'm out of here. Juan has a major-league blast at the all-star game. His all-access look behind the scenes at Nationals Park when we return.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: Yay.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Thrill of a lifetime for me to be at the MLB all-star game in D.C. earlier this week. So it's time to take you behind the scenes for all the Major League action.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Big boy's dreams come true. I'm Juan, and I get to go to the all-star game for the first time in my baseball fan life. But you know what? It's also a dream come true for a little boy named Juan. I'm going to the all-star game! Can you believe it? The all-star game. So I'm a Nationals season ticket holder, and I wanted to tell you guys and show you guys where I sit when I come to have some fun. Time off means baseball for me. So this is where I sit at Nationals Park. I want to show you where Charles Krauthammer sat. Right here, Charles, as you know, was in a wheelchair. So this was a special accommodation made for him by the team.

utterances.speaker: DAVEY JOHNSON, FORMER WASHINGTON NATIONALS MANAGER
utterances.utterance: After the games were over, he'd come and take his -- you know, he's on that wheelchair. He'd come down to the runway, and I would talk to him.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: What would he talk to you about?

utterances.speaker: JOHNSON
utterances.utterance: He'd say, "Why did you take that guy out?"

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Would he really This is the first time I've ever been to an all-star game. It's a big thrill. Is it a thrill for you as a player?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Sure. It's my first one, as well.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: OK. All-star game. I know fans think it's not that big; it's an exhibition. You say, no, no, it's really great. Because?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Well, it's great because it is an exhibition, an exhibition of the greatest players on the planet.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: I grew up a Reds fan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You grew up a Reds fan, and you play for the Reds. That's pretty -- nobody else that I've talked to has been able to say that. So ever since I was a little kid, baseball has been everything to me. And it's such a thrill that now, I get to share it with my grandson, Eli. You grew up in Detroit.

utterances.speaker: BEN CARSON, HUD SECRETARY
utterances.utterance: I did.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: So you were a Tigers fan first?

utterances.speaker: CARSON
utterances.utterance: I love the Tigers. I can tell you all the people who were on the '68 team of the World Series.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Here I am in Nationals Park in my seat at the ballpark next to my favorite baseball fan, my wife Delise. She's a bigger fan than I am, because she gets to come to all the games. You love baseball?

utterances.speaker: DELISE WILLIAMS, JUAN'S WIFE
utterances.utterance: I love baseball.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: But you love me more. You see what I mean? You see what I mean? Roy Reins (ph) is my usher and helps me out. When I catch a fly ball, what do you make me do with it?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Give it to a youngster.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Mary Catherine (ph) scores every game the old-fashioned way on her scorecard. It's a beautiful night for baseball. Let's play two, all-stars.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: Well done.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Thanks, guys.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: A cameo with Ben Carson.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes, he came over. You know, of course, my son works with Ben, so we have a little connection.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You looked like you were taking some nice cuts there. But Ben, I don't had ever, maybe, picked up a baseball bat, it looked like.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I think Ben hurt his shoulder.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Is that the reason? OK.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Actually, I was surprised. And you know what? There were kids in the outfield, and they loved it. They got a big kick out of the -- you know, the secretary being there with them, hitting baseballs.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You interview a lot of people. It's hard to interview athletes, isn't it?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: It's really hard. It was fun, because you know what? They are such good -- I was surprised. They really are good-looking young men.

utterances.speaker: HUNTSMAN
utterances.utterance: I don't disagree with you on that one. How excited with your grandson?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: He was thrilled. He had a great time.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: There's Ben. Whoa.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Eli and Rafi, my youngest son, both had fun. In fact, Rafi got to hang out -- there's Rafi -- got to hang out with big Papi.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: Is he the one that just got married?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes, he's the one just got married. But he got to hang out with big Papi, and he got to meet some of the players himself. So there's the three of us.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And he's the -- he's a Republican, right?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: That's true. I don't know what's going wrong, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: You have a beautiful family.

utterances.speaker: HUNTSMAN
utterances.utterance: he watches too much Jesse Watters is the problem.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's not a problem, Abby.

utterances.speaker: HUNTSMAN
utterances.utterance: Especially with the hairdo.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I know.

utterances.speaker: HUNTSMAN
utterances.utterance: Bouffant.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Has he commented about my hair on social media?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I don't know. I will ask him tonight. Anyway, thanks so much to Major League Baseball and the Nationals. Great time. "One More Thing" is so much fun, and it's up next.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Time now for "One More Thing" -- Kennedy.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: Well, we are celebrating the 40th anniversary of -- you know Dawn, the wonderful dishwashing soap? They have been in a partnership with the International Bird Rescue and Marine Mammal Center. They've saved over 75,000 animals in their 40-year partnership. And so we are holding baby ducklings to celebrate. And look how beautiful. This is a 2-day-old duckling. And many of his friends and ancestors have been saved, because Dawn is best at getting oil off of their feathers. And right now, this is pure down. And millions of dollars have been provided in donations thanks to this partnership. So these little guys -- I know. It's OK.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Don't pull an Ozzie.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Greg!

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: Are there more ducks? This is Canard Depardieu.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's a great name.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: By the way, I like -- he's adorable.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: It's so cute. He looks like Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Nice.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: Fuzzy and windblown.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right. They don't bite, do they?

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: No, he doesn't bite. He's just chirping. It's very sweet.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: What are they saying?

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: What do you say? You want the president --

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: -- to have another summit with Vladimir Putin?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: OK. Greg Gutfeld.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I can't match that, but I'm going to try. Let's go to --

utterances.speaker: GRAPHIC
utterances.utterance: Greg's That's Repulsive

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: "Greg's That's Repulsive." This is a terrible video. If you have children, I want them to leave the room right now. Take a look at this horrible, horrible scene. We have a -- some kind of beast running towards you --

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And then trying to get down the stairs. And then it's stuck. And then this is where it gets really disgusting. Look, it can't get down the stairs. Is this not the best thing you've ever seen in your life?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Aww.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I know. The ducks are cute.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: Greg, that is sad.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: The ducks are cute. How is this sad?

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: It's stuck.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well, somebody filming it is obviously going to help him. Or her.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Greg was complaining in the commercial that the duck upstaged his animal video.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, this is the greatest animal -- the greatest animal video ever.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Ever. Until the next one.

utterances.speaker: KENNEDY
utterances.utterance: And it's great.

utterances.speaker: HUNTSMAN
utterances.utterance: Mine's pretty good.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: What's yours, Abby?

utterances.speaker: HUNTSMAN
utterances.utterance: And I think the prerequisite to fill in for Dana is to be totally obsessed with your dog. I've got a golden retriever. If you follow me on Instagram, Golden George. So any golden retriever story, I love. This is an adorable one. Buddy is his name. And his dad, Army pilot Zach Bohaska (ph), he came home from a six-month deployment. He doesn't know that he's underneath the blankets here, but watch his tail. Look how excited he gets when his head comes out.
